meanings.sent1: The earache made it hard to concentrate in class.
meanings.sent2: She went to the doctor because her earache was getting worse.
meanings.sent3: The earache decided to visit right before the big test.
meanings.sent4: The earache was like a tiny drummer playing inside his ear.
meanings.sent5: The sharp earache felt like a needle poking his ear drum.

meanings.sent1: After swimming, she felt a slight earache in her left ear.
meanings.sent2: He tried to ignore the earache, hoping it would go away on its own.
meanings.sent3: The earache seemed to have a mind of its own, coming and going unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The persistent earache was a constant reminder of his recent cold.
meanings.sent5: The throbbing earache felt like a tiny heartbeat in his ear.
